item.title: How Jagex manages to detect bots and a possible way of fixing that :D
item.dc:creator: @xerozcheez xerozcheez
item.description:
@xerozcheez wrote:

[quote=“Krichevskoy, post:7, topic:2506”][quote author=l3etal3lade link=topic=2715.msg25724#msg25724 date=1147101156]

Nope, there’s more then just that.

Key being more then just that but it’s still a part of it so personally I think it’s a good start and worth being toyed with to find a fix. XD
[/quote]

There…uh…kind of is one - moving the mouse. Robot doesn’t allow more than one controller at a time, but perhaps if you just generated mouse events… :P[/quote]

Which bit of code sends the mouse movements to server?

Read full topic

Nope, there’s more then just that.
[/quote]

Key being more then just that but it’s still a part of it so personally I think it’s a good start and worth being toyed with to find a fix. XD[/quote]

There…uh…kind of is one - moving the mouse. Robot doesn’t allow more than one controller at a time, but perhaps if you just generated mouse events…

item.dc:creator: @xerozcheez xerozcheez
item.description:
@xerozcheez wrote:

Freddy1990:

And this is located in client.java?

Yep lol, just search around for aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method397((byte)6, 241);
aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method402((l5 << 20) + (j5 << 19) + k4); in 317 deob and work out what it is in the newest one

item.title: How Jagex manages to detect bots and a possible way of fixing that :D
item.dc:creator: @xerozcheez xerozcheez
item.description:
@xerozcheez wrote:

Well I was screwing around with my server and decided to log the mouse clicks, when I clicked an object it printed the mouse clicks (packet 241 int deob 317), and the object, then when I used my client to send fake object packets, the clicks weren’t there, so therefore jagex notices we don’t click so they ban us, maybe all that can change if someone manages to work out how the mouse clicks work

if(super.anInt26 == 2) j5 = 1; int l5 = (int)l; aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method397((byte)6, 241); aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method402((l5 << 20) + (j5 << 19) + k4);

The 241 is packet send, then it sends the variables below, this is what I got in my server box when clicking:

Mouse clicks = 71427327
atObject: 3249,3432 objectID: 299

So…yeah (H) :o

Read full topic
item.source: How Jagex manages to detect bots and a possible way of fixing that :D
